text:
One of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas. I find myself dreaming of their cervesas preparadas throughout the day and week. Long day at work, cervesa preparada. Short day at work, cervesa preparada. Definitely the tastiest I've had in Vegas. I used to end up here every week. 
I usually order a chicken enchilada or a chile relleno, but that's because I head over after work for a little beer action. Haven't eaten here for a full on dinner yet. Either way, the food is delicious, and I'd like to try more seafood.

It was a trek out to this side of town for me, but there are definitely some awesome hole-in-the-wall Mexican places in this neighborhood. La Playita is no exception, though I will note that they seem to specialize in seafood options.

CHIPS & SALSA: Thick and salty chips, fresh and mild red salsa, it's good but don't fill up on this.
EMPANADAS ($8): start with an appetizer of these, cooked perfectly with a flakey exterior and a good portion of filling. Order of 4 is available with chorizo and cheese or shrimp.
SHRIMP TACO ($3): available fried or "not fried", which comes in a warm tomato sauce almost like a seafood stew. Small in size but packed with flavor.
TOSTADA DE DEVICHE MIXTO ($5): generous portion of fresh ceviche, heavy on the octopus, topped with avocado. Simple and bright, not too acidic.

Interior is clean, small, and homey, decorated with a nautical motif. Service was friendly and fluently bilingual. Glad that this place is NOT a cash-only establishment!

Hands down the best Michelada in town. The food always tastes great and the staff is super friendly. You can't go wrong with ordering anything from the menu. I especially love the 7 mares, chilaquiles, and the Miguelito's special. My family and I love this place. We've been coming here for years.

Second time here last night and they didn't disappoint. Very colorful local place and there always seems to be something interesting happening here. Last time it was an impromptu Mexican duo singing and playing guitar. Last night it was a beautiful pair of horses outside that a couple rode in on. As for the food, I'm a fan of the bistec chipotle although you must be careful as it's one of the hotter Mexican dishes I've ever had. The shrimp and octupus cocktail comes highly recommended as well. Good prices, neighborhood atmosphere and pleasant service make this definitely above the average place in town.

Went for dinner during the week , open late so decided to try it out, it's located near broad acre swapmeet , super good food I ordered the octopus shrimp ala diabla comes with rice salad and fries, I must say one of the best ala diabla I have had and the horchata was so refreshing. I also really enjoyed the chips and salsa that they give everyone . I will surely be coming back again

I personally loved the food here. I had a carne asada burrito and it was seasoned perfectly. The flavors with all the ingredients it came with was very good. I think the rice was also seasoned well and the beans were nice. I'd say that the food gets a perfect 5 stars. However I am rating this 4 stars due to the small size of the restaurant. It was incredibly hard to get around in that place, especially when its busy. The location seems a bit dumpy as well. I remember passing by it all the time thinking eww, but after reading reviews and seeing this restaurant on Best Of Las Vegas's website, I had to give it a chance. The other factor that brings this down to 4 stars is the fact that they don't serve fountain drinks. They only serve bottle/can beverages, so don't expect free refills. Overall, a solid 4 out of 5 and worth the price as well.
Great presentation and delicious authentic Mexican food................... Great presentation and delicious authentic Mexican food...................
La Playita is fantastic!  The food and service can't be beat.  If you like Mexican seafood dishes, this is the place to be in Vegas!

This is one of the best authentic Mexican restaurants that I have found in Las Vegas. Very fresh seafood and all the other food on the menu is amazing. It's a small restaurant and doesn't look like much but the food is absolutely perfect. The staff is friendly and the prices are great. I would recommend this restaurant to anybody. Me and my family go there all the time.

Very small place & waiting for a table is usually an hour wait. Food is home style but not a great variety on drinks, they usually only have one waitress for all 15-17 tables. If the small parking lot is full, don't bother walking in.
Went there 9/10/15 for lunch. This is seriously aesome authentic mex food. Very clean and the waiter was the best. Salsa is good too but not hot enough for these two gringo's. We will be back

Outside is not great looking but don't let it deceive you! This place has great service and the great Mexican seafood.  We got michiladas,shrimp cocktails and mole enchiladas. Tons of shrimp in the cocktail. And perfect flavor.... The mole enchiladas were sweet and spicy delicious!
Find this little place and they have Great costumer service and good food. Caldos are hella good. If you visiting vegas you should go to this plase specially if you sick caldo de pollo hella good

Being from LA  first impression of this place was not so good looks bad from the outside  but let me say the food the service and the cleanliness deserved a 5 star ordered some ceviche , mojara diabla, and some oysters food  was great  service was excellent being in Vegas I don't even know how I found this place bottom line money well spent

This places serves one of the best Mexican sea food dishes I've ever had! 
Great service!
Menudo is great the red beer/micheladas/preparadas are always good. My go to place for the last year.

This place is great, a little hole in the wall just before Carey on Pecos Rd. It's $$ in cost, but worth going to! Staff is great and friendly. I had the shrimps wrapped in bacon stuffed with cheese, costa azul and it was delish!

This place does look like a whole in the wall place, but the food is fantastic. Their mariscos are always perfect and the service is so friendly. Definitely one of my favorite spots to eat. Must try it out you wont regret it.

THE PLACE FOR SOME GOOD MARISCOS!!  Great and friendly service.  Pretty good quality seafood for the amount you're paying.  Started with some chips and salsa--and I must say that's some good homemade salsa and chips.  I had the vuelva a la vida (shrimp, octopus, oyster seafood cocktail).  I love to throw some Chalula and squeeze two lemons in it. So damn good, cold and refreshing in the summer time.  Also had their michelada (bloody beer)--a definite must!  They have the bottles sugarcane Coca Colas.  Also tried their butterfly fried fish--which tasted amazing.  Tasted like pancakes with grilled onions and side of salad, rice, and tortillas. Such a far drive from where I live, but I will definitely go back.
I stopped in for a coctel to go. The service was excellent. I'll definitely be back to try more of the menu.
I never give 4 stars ever, but the Caldo 7 Mares is the best in town..its just the waitresses are flirty??? Dont need that distraction with my handsome husband.

Yum yum! This place looks like a hole in the wall, has barred windows and Spanish speaking only staff and also has excelente food! I got a small mixed ceviche - fish, shrimp and octopus and it was delectable. Two $3 cervezas later I had a beef taco (tiny but good) and a pork tamale (decent, yes!). This place gets a thumbs up from me. So many yummy Mexican seafood options. :p

This little neighborhood restaurant has been around for years.  Driving down the street you may just pass it by, but don't!  They have everything on the menu from enchiladas, carne Asada to seafood. My absolute favorite is the fried whole fish and grilled shrimp. Yummmm.

We have tried La Playita a few times for breakfast on the weekends normally having the chilaquiles and usually happy with them.
So we decided to try for a dinner.  Served a nice spicy chunky salsa and cold chips upon sitting down.  We ordered the bacon wrapped shrimp, the empanadas and 2 chili relleno plate.
Food arrived very quickly and was pretty down hill from there.  Empanadas were not hot all the way thru.  The relleno plate use anaheim chilis and were not very good.  Bacon wrapped shrimp was wrapped with to much bacon and the layer of bacon under the first wrap was raw.  I returned that plate of shrimp and told them I did not want anything in its place.
I do not think we will be trying this place again.

This place is legit if you want some delicious  seafood. I've been to a whole lot of mariscos  places including in Mexico and this place definitely authentic. The staff is ALWAYS nice and attentive to you. You feel right at home the way the place is set up. Recommend you get the Micheladas sooo good ! Very good prices too.

The reviews were right! Place looks like a hole in the wall but the food and service is great :) .. I came with my family we got 1)enchiladas de mole 2) camarones a la diabla 3) shrimp cocktail ... Everyone loved their food.. The shrimp cocktail was perfect and the restaurant wasn't stingy with the shrimp, the mole was sweet, and they gave us homemade tortillas .. Give the place a try ,you will be glad you came!
